relationships.description: Laffer was part of Reagan's Kitchen Cabinet and economic advisor
Laffer draws parallels between Trump's 2016 campaign and Reagan's 1980 campaign
Clinton positioned as continuation of Obama's policies and legacy

transactions: Hillary Clinton's cattle futures investment turning $1,000 into $100,000

analysis.purpose: To predict Donald Trump's victory in the 2016 presidential election and provide economic/political analysis supporting this prediction
analysis.significance: Economic analysis from prominent supply-side economist predicting Trump's election victory with detailed statistical support

notable_quotes: Donald Trump will be the next President of the United States after having won an easy victory over Hillary Clinton in November 2016.
The circumstances today are almost identical to those of 1980â€”16 years of bad economics about to be followed by a political renaissance.
One academic study published in The Journal of Economics and Finance estimated the likelihood of achieving a result such as Clinton's as 1 in 31 trillion.
red_flags: Questionable cattle futures returns by Hillary Clinton
References to multiple Clinton-related scandals and controversies

blackmail_indicators.description: No evidence of blackmail or coercion found in this economic analysis report

illegal_activity.description: Document is an economic analysis report with no evidence of first-hand illegal activity

details: References to Wall Street Journal article
Journal of Economics and Finance study

public_knowledge.context: Economic analysis predicting presidential election outcomes from a well-known supply-side economist

analysis.summary: Arthur Laffer's economic analysis predicts Donald Trump will win the 2016 presidential election in a Reagan-like landslide, citing economic indicators, primary turnout data, and historical parallels between Trump's campaign and Reagan's 1980 victory while criticizing Hillary Clinton's record and judgment.
